content:
Diagnosis:	Pineoblastoma, Chang M0

Management:	12 Mar 2024 Endoscopic third ventriculostomy and tumor biopsy

Histology:	Pineoblastoma, WHO grade 4
	INI1 retained, Ki67 80%

Current Situation:	Post-operative recovery, preparing for adjuvant therapy

[redacted name] is a 14 year old who presented with 6 weeks of headaches and vomiting. MRI brain showed obstructive hydrocephalus from a 3.2cm pineal mass. Emergency endoscopic third ventriculostomy was performed with concurrent biopsy confirming pineoblastoma. Post-operative MRI shows good decompression of ventricles with residual 2.8cm enhancing pineal mass. Spine MRI and CSF cytology negative for dissemination.

On examination today, alert and oriented with resolving papilledema. No focal neurological deficits. Performance status 1.

Plan for craniospinal radiotherapy 36Gy in 20 fractions with boost to primary site to 54Gy, followed by adjuvant chemotherapy as per PNET protocol. Will commence radiotherapy planning next week with aim to start treatment in 2 weeks time. Follow-up arranged in combined neuro-oncology clinic during week 1 of radiotherapy.

primary_cancer.metastases: no dissemination on spine MRI and CSF cytology

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain showed 3.2cm pineal mass causing obstructive hydrocephalus
Endoscopic third ventriculostomy and tumor biopsy
Post-operative MRI shows good ventricle decompression with residual 2.8cm enhancing pineal mass
Spine MRI and CSF cytology negative for dissemination

patient_facts.value: presented with 6 weeks of headaches and vomiting
alert and oriented with resolving papilledema

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed localized pineoblastoma post emergency surgical decompression. Good post-operative recovery with residual disease suitable for radical chemoradiotherapy
Post-operative recovery phase, preparing for adjuvant therapy
Combined neuro-oncology clinic during week 1 of radiotherapy
